item.title: Hosting your own instance
item.description: Prerequisites We highly recommend using Docker to host the application. It's the easiest and fastest way to get started and stay up to date with any future release. You'll also need a Postgres 9.6+ database, which could also be hosted on Docker, but that's not required. Installing and Running Step 1: Create a docker compose file Create a file named docker-compose.yml and copy content below. Read comments for to know what settings are available.

item.title: Configuring OAuth
item.description: Why is this required? Authentication is a key component of Fider platform. We take security and usability very seriously, which is why we’ve decided to go with Social sign in as the main authentication method. If you’ve just got started with Fider, you’ll need a Facebook, Google and/or GitHub app to get authentication to work. But don’t worry, it’s a very easy and fast setup explained below. Facebook https://developers.facebook.com/apps/ Google

item.title: How to enable SSL
item.description: Prerequisites In order to configure HTTPS, you’ll need a Certificate and the Private Key. How to enable it Fider v0.3.0 shipped with two new environment variables that you’ll need to set. SSL_CERT: This is the path to the Certificate file. SSL_CERT_KEY: This is the path to the Private Key file. If you’re using Docker, these files won’t be inside the container, but Fider will need to have access to it.
